title: pptfig overview and examples
text: Welcome overview examples Integral’s PowerPoint theme, ppttheme() figure function, pptfig(). first step load library. library two functions, ppttheme() theme associated ggplot2 pptfig() handles placing figures PowerPoint template.

title: pptfig overview and examples
text: current ppttheme() shown . theme loaded library example
code: #' theme for PowerPoint slide ppttheme <- function() {   return(ggplot2::theme(text = ggplot2::element_text(family = "sans")) +     ggplot2::theme_bw() +     ggplot2::theme(       legend.title = ggplot2::element_blank(), legend.text = ggplot2::element_text(color = "black", size = 8),       legend.background = ggplot2::element_rect(size = .5, linetype = "solid", color = "black")     ) +     ggplot2::theme(       panel.grid.minor = ggplot2::element_blank(),       panel.background = ggplot2::element_blank(),       axis.line = ggplot2::element_line(colour = "black", size = 1)     ) +     ggplot2::theme(axis.text.x = ggplot2::element_text(color = "black", size = 8, vjust = 0.5, angle = 0)) +     ggplot2::theme(axis.text.y = ggplot2::element_text(color = "black", size = 8, vjust = 0.5, angle = 0)) +     ggplot2::theme(axis.title.x = ggplot2::element_text(color = "black", size = 9, face = "bold")) +     ggplot2::theme(axis.title.y = ggplot2::element_text(color = "black", size = 9, face = "bold")) +     ggplot2::theme(plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(size = 10, hjust = 0.5, face = "bold")) +     ggplot2::theme(axis.ticks = ggplot2::element_line(size = 1)) +     ggplot2::theme(axis.line = ggplot2::element_line(size = 1)) +     ggplot2::theme(strip.background = ggplot2::element_rect(fill = "white")) +     ggplot2::theme(panel.border = ggplot2::element_rect(fill = NA, size = 0.25)) +     ggplot2::theme(strip.text = ggplot2::element_text(face = "bold", size = 9)) +     ggplot2::theme(plot.margin = ggplot2::unit(c(0.5, 0.5, .5, 0.5), "cm"))) } theme <- integral::ppttheme()

title: pptfig overview and examples
text: pptfig() handles placing figures PowerPoint template. example using letter landscape . example using letter legal presentations sizes .
code: # used to read data for this example library(dataRetrieval) # library in this vignette library(integral) # library for graphics creation library(ggplot2) # library to convert graphics to Office compatible graphic library(rvg)  ###Theme theme <- integral::ppttheme() ###Data Q <- dataRetrieval::readNWISuv(site = "01114500", parameterCd = "00060", startDate = as.Date("2020-01-01"))  ###Figure p <- ggplot() +   geom_path(data = Q, aes(x = dateTime, y = X_00060_00000)) +   geom_hline(yintercept = 200, color = "red", size = 1.5) +   annotate("text", x = as.POSIXct("2020-04-01"), y = 200, label = "Line", vjust = 1.8) +   labs(title = "USGS Stream Gage 01114500, 2020", x = NULL, y = "Discharge (cfs)") +   theme  ###pptfig ### landscape 11 x 8.5 orientation <- "L" size <- "letter" fig <- rvg::dml(ggobj = p) section <- "X" fig.num <- 1 doc.title.1 <- "Discharge at USGS Stream Gage 01114500" doc.title.2 <- "Project Description 1" doc.title.3 <- "Project Description 2" draft <- "DRAFT" note <- "Note: Data pulled using readNWISuv." author <- "Eben Pendleton"  my_pres <- read_pptx_template(size, orientation)  my_pres <- pptfig(my_pres, size, orientation, fig, section, fig.num, note, author, doc.title.1,                   doc.title.2, doc.title.3, draft)  print(my_pres, "OutputL11x8.5.pptx") # used to read data for this example library(dataRetrieval) # library in this vignette library(integral) # library for graphics creation library(ggplot2) # library to convert graphics to Office compatible graphic library(rvg)  ###Theme theme <- integral::ppttheme() ###Data Q <- dataRetrieval::readNWISuv(site = "01114500", parameterCd = "00060", startDate = as.Date("2020-01-01"))  ###Figure p <- ggplot() +   geom_path(data = Q, aes(x = dateTime, y = X_00060_00000)) +   geom_hline(yintercept = 200, color = "red", size = 1.5) +   annotate("text", x = as.POSIXct("2020-04-01"), y = 200, label = "Line", vjust = 1.8) +   labs(title = "USGS Stream Gage 01114500, 2020", x = NULL, y = "Discharge (cfs)") +   theme  ###pptfig ### landscape 11 x 8.5 orientation <- "L" size <- "letter" fig <- rvg::dml(ggobj = p) section <- "X" fig.num <- 1 doc.title.1 <- "Discharge at USGS Stream Gage 01114500" doc.title.2 <- "Project Description 1" doc.title.3 <- "Project Description 2" draft <- "DRAFT" note <- "Note: Data pulled using readNWISuv." author <- "Eben Pendleton" my_pres <- read_pptx_template(size, orientation)  my_pres <- pptfig(my_pres, size, orientation, fig, section, fig.num, note, author, doc.title.1,                   doc.title.2, doc.title.3, draft)  print(my_pres, "OutputL11x8.5.pptx")  ### portrait 8.5 x 11 size <- "letter" orientation <- "P" fig <- rvg::dml(ggobj = p) section <- "X" fig.num <- 1 doc.title.1 <- "Discharge at USGS Stream Gage 01114500" doc.title.2 <- "Project Description 1" doc.title.3 <- "Project Description 2" draft <- "DRAFT" note <- "Note: Data pulled using readNWISuv." author <- "Eben Pendleton"  my_pres <- read_pptx_template(size, orientation)  my_pres <- pptfig(my_pres, size, orientation, fig, section, fig.num, note, author, doc.title.1,                   doc.title.2, doc.title.3, draft) print(my_pres, "OutputP8.5x11.pptx")  # ledger # landscape 17 x 11 size <- "ledger" orientation <- "L" fig <- rvg::dml(ggobj = p) section <- "X" fig.num <- 1 doc.title.1 <- "Discharge at USGS Stream Gage 01114500" doc.title.2 <- "Project Description 1" doc.title.3 <- "Project Description 2" draft <- "DRAFT" note <- "Note: Data pulled using readNWISuv." author <- "Eben Pendleton"  my_pres <- read_pptx_template(size, orientation)  my_pres <- pptfig(my_pres, size, orientation, fig, section, fig.num, note, author, doc.title.1,                   doc.title.2, doc.title.3, draft)  print(my_pres, "OutputL17x11.pptx") # # ### portrait 11 x 17 size <- "ledger" orientation <- "P" fig <- rvg::dml(ggobj = p) section <- "X" fig.num <- 1 doc.title.1 <- "Discharge at USGS Stream Gage 01114500" doc.title.2 <- "Project Description 1" doc.title.3 <- "Project Description 2" draft <- "DRAFT" note <- "Note: Data pulled using readNWISuv." author #> [1] "Eben Pendleton"  my_pres <- read_pptx_template(size, orientation) my_pres <- pptfig(my_pres, size, orientation, fig, section, fig.num, note, author, doc.title.1,                   doc.title.2, doc.title.3, draft) print(my_pres, "OutputP11x17.pptx")

title: xlsxtable
text: Welcome overview examples Integral’s Excel table function. first step load library

title: xlsxtable
text: example dataframe table . ’s example using workbook. used adding multiple tables
code: ## Example code table.num <- 1 #Create title title <- paste("Table A-",table.num, "Example Table",sep="")  #Select style (LL for letter-landscape, LP for letter-portrait, and LD for Ledger (11x17)) style <- "LD"  #Select number of identifier columns (non-numeric columns such as "chemical name") that should be left justified (instead of centered) leftjust <- 2  int_vec <- c('1', '2', '3') char_vec <- c("a", "b", "c") bool_vec <- c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE) d <- data.frame(int_vec, char_vec, bool_vec)  fpath <- "outtable.xlsx" sheet <- "Sheet1" title <- "Example Table" author <- "Eben Pendleton" # This returns the Excel out file path if successful. outpath <- xlsxtable(sheet, d, title, author, fpath = fpath) fpath <- "outtable.xlsx" sheet <- "Sheet2" title <- "Example Table" author <- "Eben Pendleton"  # create workbook wb <- openxlsx::createWorkbook()  # This returns the Excel workbook object if successful. wb <- xlsxtable(sheet, d, title, author, wb = wb)  # Save the workbook openxlsx::saveWorkbook(wb, file = fpath, overwrite = TRUE)

Interactive filter helper — idf
text: shortcut interactive data exploration makes easy filter rows match value key column tibble. produces result filter(your_key_col == key_value). However following advantages: Less typing Saves key value hidden environment variable, calling subsequently (perhaps different table) necessary specify key value.

title: Interactive filter helper — idf
Interactive filter helper — idf
text: id vector containing key value(s) want filter. first time function called specified key value, value stored hidden object need specified . glimpse Print output using dplyr::glimpse, defaults FALSE.

title: Interactive filter helper — idf
text: data filtered key value key column stored options("idf_data_key")

title: Interactive filter helper — idf
text: working set tables -common id column (example "unitid" IPEDS offender number UDC data) often case find individual issue one table, want see data individual another table. Rather constantly use filter() matching argument, function lets just specify id value . goal often look id value one table immediately look table, function also saves whatever last id value necessary specify subsequent function calls.

title: Interactive filter helper — idf

title: Function to place R generated figures into a PowerPoint Template — pptfig
code: pptfig(   my_pres,   size,   orientation,   fig,   section,   fignum,   note,   author,   doctitle1,   doctitle2 = "",   doctitle3 = "",   draft = "DRAFT",   pc = "Privileged and Confidential",   showpath = T )

title: Function to place R generated figures into a PowerPoint Template — pptfig
text: my_pres read_pptx_template function size Presentation size (letter ledger) orientation Presentation orientation landscape (L) Portrait (P) fig graphics object compactiable officer section section number X- fignum figure number section-figure number note Figure notes text include figure author script author doctitle1 Document Title 1 doctitle2 Optional Document Title 2 doctitle3 Optional Document Title 3 draft Optional Bold red text included next figure caption (ex. "DRAFT") pc Optional Privileged Confidential label showpath Optional Show script path page. Default True

title: Function to place R generated figures into a PowerPoint Template — pptfig
text: PowerPoint presentation added figure Note: function dml() creates editable figure PowerPoint fig <- dml(ggobj = p) #ggplot object fig <- dml(grid.arrange(p1, p2, p3, p4, nrow = 4))

title: Function to place R generated figures into a PowerPoint Template — pptfig
code: size <- c("letter") orientation <- c("L") fig <- ggplot2::ggplot() section <- c("X") fignum <- c("1") note <- "Figure Note" author <- "Eben Pendleton" doctitle1 <- "Document Title" my_pres <- read_pptx_template(size, orientation) my_pres <- pptfig(my_pres, size, orientation, fig, section, fignum, note, author,   doctitle1,   doctitle2 = "", doctitle3 = "",   draft = "DRAFT" )  # Print presentation in calling script # print(my_pres, "Output_File-Name.pptx") #must end in .pptx

title: Creating a new column with significance labels — signif_column
Creating a new column with significance labels — signif_column
text: data Data frame variables specified preferentially taken. p column containing p-values. ... Currently ignored.

title: Creating a new column with significance labels — signif_column
text: Returns dataframe tibble format additional column corresponding APA-format statistical significance labels.

title: Creating a new column with significance labels — signif_column
text: Indrajeet Patil

title: Creating a new column with significance labels — signif_column
code: # preparing a new dataframe df <- cbind.data.frame(   x = 1:5,   y = 1,   p.value = c(0.1, 0.5, 0.00001, 0.05, 0.01) )  # dataframe with significance column signif_column(data = df, p = p.value) #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>       x     y p.value significance #>   <int> <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>        #> 1     1     1 0.1     ns           #> 2     2     1 0.5     ns           #> 3     3     1 0.00001 ***          #> 4     4     1 0.05    ns           #> 5     5     1 0.01    *

title: Table Template — xlsxtable
text: Apply Integral table style table report-ready output

title: Table Template — xlsxtable
code: xlsxtable(   sheet,   d,   title,   author,   fpath = NULL,   wb = NULL,   style = "L",   leftjust = 1,   startcol = 1,   startrow = 2 )

title: Table Template — xlsxtable
text: sheet sheet(s) added workbook d data frame table created title title table author Author name fpath Optional file path write table wb Optional workbook option style Orientation page size table leftjust Number columns left justified startcol Optional start column table startrow Optional start row table

title: Table Template — xlsxtable
text: formatted data table

title: Table Template — xlsxtable
code: int_vec <- c('1', '2', '3') char_vec <- c("a", "b", "c") bool_vec <- c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE) d <- data.frame(   int_vec, char_vec,   bool_vec ) # Example using a file path # Note: temp file used to pass build check. Use a non temp file path in reality. fpath <- tempfile(fileext = ".xlsx") sheet <- "Sheet1" title <- "Example Table" author <- "Eben Pendleton" outpath <- xlsxtable(sheet, d, title, author, fpath = fpath)  # Example using a workbook object fpath <- tempfile(fileext = ".xlsx") sheet <- "Sheet2" title <- "Example Table" author <- "Eben Pendleton" # create workbook wb <- openxlsx::createWorkbook() # This returns the Excel workbook object if successful. wb <- xlsxtable(sheet, d, title, author, wb = wb) # Save the workbook openxlsx::saveWorkbook(wb, file = fpath, overwrite = TRUE)

integral 0.0.5
text: Added qa() function

title: integral 0.0.4
text: Patch fix save_csv_wlog() function export namespace Added copy_file_wlog() function

title: Integral 0.0.3
text: added ic_new_proj(), ic_new_r_file(), ic_new_python_file(), ic_new_rmd_file(), ic_new_script() ic_new_git() project file creation. supported ic_new_script() creating none Rmarkdown files, convert_winpath() convert Windows paths series ask() functions.

title: integral 0.0.2.9006
text: Added experimental helper functions searching Stack Overflow Google stackoverflow() alias () search Stack Overflow terms pass. Automatically adds “[r]” tag. google() searches Google terms pass. Automatically adds required “R” tag omits results web sites provide information help documentation R. so_last_error() google_last_error() collect traceback recent error searches using Stack Overflow Google, respectively. Automatically adds R tag (google) omits results web sites duplicated R manual.

title: integral 0.0.2.9005
text: Added quote_values() converts series comma separated values vector input format. Copy Hmisc::Cs() convenience. Added ic_visdat_grouped() extends visdat allow separate plots grouped variable data. useful annual data groupings may explain missinginess.

title: integral 0.0.2.9004
text: Added ic_scale_si_unit() converts numeric values International System units Added ic_scale_big_dollar() converts numeric values dollar units using suffixes, ie: 1000 becomes $1k.

title: integral 0.0.2.9003
text: Added %ni% (), opposite %% Added xview() opens table Excel. Added interactive helper common_vars(), shows common variable names two tibbles. Added interactive helper wc() (write clip) copies object clipboard. object passed, defaults .Last.value. Added huck(), negation purrr::pluck() discards element list using tidyselect specifications. Added deselect(), negation dplyr::select() (ie select(-c(...))) since wrapping tidyselect vars c() annoys . Added fct_case_when(), implementation dplyr::case_when() output ordered factor order conditions. Added zscore() convenience function wrapper around scale() returns vector instead matrix.

title: integral 0.0.1.9000
text: Added beta version interactive helper cheat() lists cheatsheets opens selected one. Added interactive helper idf() (ID filter). function makes easy filter key column multiple tables dataset. key column set options (function ask set already) isn’t necessary type call, previous key value used updated. See ?idf details. Added state_locations() returns tibble location U.S. states map (top, middle, bottom) can handle Albers. Useful dynamically adjusting pop-directions (/) maps prevent panning.

title: integral 0.0.0.9000
text: Added ic_update checks new dev version integral github, found automatically unloads integral, downloads new version installs , reloads integral. Added loading message informs user new version integral Added ic_news() shows news updates version bumps
